meanings.definition: Partially high in position or elevation.
meanings.sent1: The bird built its nest in a semihigh tree.
meanings.sent2: The airplane flew at a semihigh altitude.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reach the semihigh shelf but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: The sun cast a semihigh shadow on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The mountain appeared semihigh against the horizon.

meanings.definition: Moderately high in rank or importance.
meanings.sent1: She held a semihigh position in the company.
meanings.sent2: The painting was of semihigh value to the art collector.
meanings.sent3: The dog acted as if it had a semihigh status in the park.
meanings.sent4: His achievements placed him in a semihigh league of professionals.
meanings.sent5: The castle stood semihigh above the surrounding town.
